@nejsnave Finally, while I agree 100% that solving the underlying issues is what is urgently needed, that doesn't mean that until that's done, we should force people to suffer so we can feel better about ourselves and our society

@nejsnave Once I decided that I would die instead of being homeless, it just meant a painful life could end with a painless death (and one that did not traumatize others).  Third, and this is stated clearly in the story, nobody pushed MAiD on me.  In fact, they tried talking me out of it.

@nejsnave As someone who is quoted extensively in this story, I'd like to clarify some things.  First, I would have qualified just on the basis of  physical and mental suffering.  Second, when faced with homelessness on top of that, MAiD was not a factor in choosing death over homelessness

Just wanted to thank everyone for your kind words and well wishes.  Whatever this is, it's really kicking my behind.  I was up for maybe 2 hours and now completely exhausted again.  Going to crash again and hope I feel vaguely human when I get up.  Goodnight all.

Woke up with a fever, aches and pains, scratchy throat, the works.  Thankfully, the test says it's not the plague, but I still feel like death warmed over.  Time for vitamin C, hot cocoa, and lots of sleep today.  If messages go unanswered, I'm not ignoring you, I'm passed out.

@EmeraldCityML @MarxistRealism You seem to be think that MAiD was a choice between life and death.  It wasn't.  At the time that I applied, I had decided to end my life, barring a miracle (and yes, the miracle happened).  All MAiD would have done is to make sure that death did not entail suffering.
@1Jedi_Rey @cevapicel @MarxistRealism Thank you.
@nejsnave Yay!

@BenjaminNorton To all of you who reached out with offers of help, since my situation has gotten so much better, I would ask that you consider helping Mina, A good friend, who is facing the same decision  https://t.co/oRpNP9ohGc

@MarxistRealism To all of you who reached out with offers of help, since my situation has gotten so much better, I would ask that you consider helping Mina, A good friend, who is facing the same decision  https://t.co/oRpNP9ohGc
@CityNewsTO @CityCynthia As for myself, I couldn't be more grateful.  If Cynthia hadn't taken an interest, and allowed me to have a voice, I'd be dead now instead of arguing with you fine folks.

@CityNewsTO @CityCynthia If anyone actually bothered to read (or watch) the full story, you'd see that both Cynthia and I mention that this was like winning a lottery, and not a fix, and that the broken system needs to fixed to help the hundreds of thousands who didn't win the lottery.

@FrenlyOfficer As long as it is a life worthy of being called that, I'm right there with you.  And, in fact, because of the literally thousands of people who have helped, I'll be around for a while yet :)

@FrenlyOfficer Would someone in my situation jumping in front of a subway train somehow make you happier?  Swallowing a gun in a hotel room? Swan dive off a roof?  Ziploc bag, helium and duct tape?  Car in a garage? Or must disabled Canadians suffer in perpetuity so you don't get disgusted?

@ancientastrokn3 This is her GoFundMe page.  Feel free to share it:

https://t.co/oRpNP9ohGc

@cevapicel @MarxistRealism Yes, that would be the ideal solution.  However, until we do, forcing people to suffer a some sort of salve for the collective conscience of those who abandoned them to begin with seems a little much.
@marbeille @layne_madeline @MarxistRealism Ghorbanat beram azizam.  Kheili mamnoon.
@MstrWaterbender @MarxistRealism I did.

@FrenlyOfficer Just so you know, I'm not the one who went to the media.  My only agenda was to die.  one of only 2 people who knew told them about my story, which resulted in the interview, and now i get to to listen to you instead of being dead.  Guess every silver lining must have a cloud.

@liztweetinstuff Thank you so much ‚ù§Ô∏è

@layne_madeline @MarxistRealism Thank you.  Someone already did that a coupe of weeks ago (the video of me is actually from early October), and my situation has changed drastically since.  A follow up interview with all the details will be airing tomorrow on City News Toronto.

@ancientastrokn3 I wasn't referring to you, but a number of people have started using my story to paint Canada as a failing society, and that I object to.  Someone already started one, and it actually exceeded the goal set within 4 days, so my situation is no longer the one in that video

@liztweetinstuff Thank you, that's very kind.  My situation, thankfully has stabilized enough that it looks like I'll make it, so at the moment, I no longer need any more funds (I now have enough to supplement my benefits until I get into permanent affordable housing).

@cevapicel @MarxistRealism Compared to freezing to death on a subway grate, it is.  Though if you are unfortunate enough to one day find yourself faced with those options, you're free to choose whichever option you define as "dying well", and I will pay you the courtesy of not lecturing you about it.
@basedtool But those I could, and have been, handling for years.  The soul crushing, enforced, legislated poverty that was about to make me homeless, that I wasn't prepared to deal with.

@basedtool 24/7 pain due to a broken vertebrae that healed crookedly and has caused severe spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, osteoarthritis, PTSD, panic anxiety disorder, depression, pretty severe asthma (need 3 different inhalers to breathe), early stages of COPD, and a few more.
@stardwvlley Thank you.

@jenelaina I hope so too.  If my story can somehow keep the conversation going and help bring about some much needed change to the system, then all the stress, pain and misery I've dealt with over the last few years will have been worth it.
@InclusionCA Those are the actual words on the MAiD form (I should know, I'm looking at mine to make sure I got it right).

@InclusionCA "They have a serious and incurable illness,disease,OR disability and they are in an advanced state of irreversible decline in capacity and they are experiencing enduring physical or psychological suffering due to illness,disease,disability or state of decline that is intolerable"

@WattdeFook @MarxistRealism In other words, while living with the pain was bearable...Just, living with the pain while homeless was not.  As I said, I agree the system is broken.  But blaming my doctor for being compassionate is beyond the pale,
@cheytownny @MarxistRealism Thank you‚ù§Ô∏è

@fanniesdream For those in the US, help this woman who is facing the same dreadful choice by contributing to the fundraiser started by her friend.  She deserves a chance at life:

https://t.co/oRpNP9ohGc

@fanniesdream Thanks so much for asking.  For those in Canada, please write to your provincial and federal representatives, and ask them to increase provincial disability support payments and services (E.G. Physio, massage, Chiropractic are no longer covered by ODSP in Ontario).
@MarxistRealism Sure, sounds good.  The wider the conversation goes, the better as far as I'm concerned.
@MarxistRealism Should say "solution isn't to take away MAiD.  I swear the autocorrect is possessed.
@MarxistRealism And due to an amazing outpouring of love and support from so many people, I am no longer in that position.
@MarxistRealism That being said, the system IS definitely broken.  The solution isn't to take away made though.  It's making life bearable enough that it would no longer be a good option.

@MarxistRealism It's not a "death slip", but a voluntary application for MAiD that I had made of my own free will. I do qualify on medical grounds due to medical issues, but staring homelessness in the face was the last straw. He deserves a medal for being compassionate enough to understand.

It seems my story has been hijacked by the right trying to spin it into their own agenda.  I hope people don't get distracted by this.  The real issue isn't whether or not someone like me should be able to access MAiD.  It's making life bearable enough that they won't need to.
